intro: Agnirictus, commonly known as the Indian nettle or Indian nettle plant, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Urticaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems that are covered in fine hairs and have a distinctive stinging sensation when touched. The leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a serrated edge. Agnirictus produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. It is native to various parts of Asia, including India, and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
